intro: Borreria geeingwa var. hispida, commonly known as the woolly borreria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique texture and floral display.
